column4: good evening, does anybody use Audacity, and know how to stop a crackling distortion?

best way is to use 32-bit float format instead of the usual 16-bit, and ummmm... try playing around with the volume levels; maybe it's only being distorted on playback. when exactly do you get distortion?
you shouldn't be getting cracklies when playing back in Audacity though... I've never had that problem...
do you get the cracklies when you're recording, or when you're playing back?
only when playing back something just recorded
hum. Audacity does have its own volume controls; I assume you've played around with those, eh?
I agree with you on Mandrake!

glad you agree with me about Mandrake :) I find Mandrake's controls are too spread out and scattered... mind you, I'm also comfortable with going to the command line if there's a setting missing from any of Ubuntu's graphical thingies
gee whiz, no :) I wouldn't know where to get a (legitimate) copy of CoolEdit anyway... I just use Ardour and JACK
rather steep learning curve, but it's a beautiful program once you get over its idiosyncracies
I never did get BeOS to work on my computer, which is a shame, because it always looked so cool and sensible.
Celeron, back then. TheMuso: yeah, Jack is pretty astounding...
thanks for your audacious help -- :-) time for some tube and some grub G'night
